definitions.definition: A long-drawn, high-pitched complaining cry or sound
A complaint or criticism
To utter a high-pitched cry.
To make a sound resembling such a cry.
definitions.example: The jet engines whined at take off.

definitions.definition: To complain or protest with a whine or as if with a whine.
To move with a whining sound.
definitions.example: The jet whined into the air.

definitions.definition: To utter with the sound of a whine.
definitions.example: Kelly Queen was whining that the boss made him put on his tie.

definitions.definition: Participation in illegal behaviour by minors.
A programme transmitted in this manner.
To transmit a programme to selected individuals or groups, especially via cable.
To transmit a medical intervention to a specific organ or type of tissue.
A natural disaster that involves the breakup and downhill flow of rock, mud, water and anything caught in the path.
A vote won by a wide or overwhelming majority.
definitions.example: The candidate won by a landslide.

definitions.definition: To undergo a landslide.
(collective) Items that have been or are about to be ejected from a boat or balloon.
The action of jettisoning items.
To eject from a boat, submarine, aircraft, spaceship or hot-air balloon, so as to lighten the load.
definitions.example: The ballooners had to jettison all of their sand bags to make it over the final hill.

definitions.definition: To let go or get rid of as being useless or defective.
To honour the memory of someone or something with a ceremony or object.
definitions.example: On November 11th we commemorate the fallen with a march.

definitions.definition: To serve as a memorial to someone or something.
definitions.example: The cenotaph commemorates the fallen.

definitions.definition: An exercise done to improve upper body strength, performed by resting on one's toes and hands and pushing one's weight off the floor.
A push-up bra.
To perform a push-up, or to lift oneself off the ground in a push-up-like manner.
Supporting the breasts to increase their apparent size.
Designed to be worn rolled up.
In a political manner
Regarding politics, in a way connected to politics
Having a face that appears childlike, innocent, or youthful.
definitions.example: Michelle was of the opinion that all the best con artists were baby-faced, since that inspires trust in others.

definitions.definition: Second, 1/60 of a minute.

One-sixtieth of a minute; the SI unit of time, defined as the duration of 9,192,631,770 periods of radiation corresponding to the transition between two hyperfine levels of caesium-133 in a ground state at a temperature of absolute zero and at rest.
A unit of angle equal to one-sixtieth of a minute of arc or one part in 3600 of a degree.
A short, indeterminate amount of time.
definitions.example: I'll be there in a second.

synonyms: Words used as placeholders to count seconds

definitions.definition: A judgment of the rightness or wrongness of something, based on a particular set of values or on a particular value system.
A field or pasture; a piece of land covered or cultivated with grass, usually intended to be mown for hay.
Low land covered with coarse grass or rank herbage near rivers and in marshy places by the sea.
definitions.example: the salt meadows near Newark Bay

definitions.definition: A place where tickets are sold in a theatre/theater or cinema.
(by extension) the total amount of money paid by people worldwide to watch a movie at cinemas/movie theaters.
A piece of paper that entitles the holder to a discount, or that can be exchanged for goods and services.
A receipt.
One who or that which vouches.
A copy of a published advertisement sent by the agency to the client as proof of publication.
A mechanical device used in shops for automatically registering the amount of money drawn.
To establish the authenticity of; to vouch for.
To provide a vouch for (an expenditure).
To provide (a beneficiary) with a voucher.
The middle period of one's life.
Occurring in the middle point of one's life, usually considered about 45.
Perfumed talc (sometimes with the addition of boric acid) for adsorbing moisture on the skin.
Lawfulness.

The defensive players who are in position behind the defensive linemen and in front of the safeties and cornerbacks and whose principal responsibilities are to tackle runners and to defend against shorter passes
definitions.example: The linebacker corralled the runner who had slipped through the hole.

definitions.definition: A participant who enters something, such as a contest.
A newcomer.
A trainee, especially in a skilled trade.

One who is bound by indentures or by legal agreement to serve a tradesperson, or other person, for a certain time, with a view to learn the art, or trade, in which his master is bound to instruct him.
One not well versed in a subject; a tyro or newbie.
To put under the care and supervision of a master, for the purpose of instruction in a trade or business.
definitions.example: He was apprenticed to a local employer.

definitions.definition: To be an apprentice to.
definitions.example: Joe apprenticed three different photographers before setting up his own studio.

definitions.definition: To pass an iron over (clothing or some other item made of cloth) in order to remove creases.
To shackle with irons; to fetter or handcuff.
To furnish or arm with iron.
definitions.example: to iron a wagon

definitions.definition: The act of pressing clothes with an iron.
definitions.example: I hate ironing.

definitions.definition: Laundry that has been washed and is ready to be ironed.
definitions.example: I really should make a start on the ironing soon.

definitions.definition: Laundry that has recently been ironed.
definitions.example: I really should put the ironing away.

definitions.definition: A large room, especially one used to receive and entertain guests.
A gathering of people for a social or intellectual meeting.
An art gallery or exhibition; especially the Paris salon or autumn salon.
A beauty salon or similar establishment.
A broad ski used for water skiing.
To ride on water skis
Without a strap or straps; usually describing women's clothing without shoulder straps.
A contrapuntal piece of music wherein a particular melody is played in a number of voices, each voice introduced in turn by playing the melody.
Anything in literature, poetry, film, painting, etc., that resembles a fugue in structure or in its elaborate complexity and formality.
A fugue state.
To improvise, in singing, by introducing vocal ornamentation to fill gaps etc.
The fruit of the carambola tree, Averrhoa carambola.
A small restaurant.
A small bar or pub.
The top of the head; the skull.
The part of the head where the hair grows from, or used to grow from.
A part of the skin of the head, with the hair attached, formerly cut or torn off from an enemy by warriors in some cultures as a token of victory.
definitions.example: Some tribes used to collect scalps to prove how many of the enemy they had killed in battle.

definitions.definition: The skin of the head of a stag with the horns attached.
A victory, especially at the expense of someone else.
A bed or stratum of shellfish.
The top; the summit.
To remove the scalp (part of the head from where the hair grows), by brutal act or accident.
To resell, especially tickets, usually for an inflated price, often illegally.
definitions.example: Tickets were being scalped for $300.

definitions.definition: On an open outcry exchange trading floor, to buy and sell rapidly for one's own account, aiming to buy from a seller and a little later sell to a buyer, making a small profit from the difference (roughly the amount of the bid/offer spread, or less).
To screen or sieve ore before further processing.
definitions.example: scalped ore

definitions.definition: To remove the skin of.
To remove the grass from.
To destroy the political influence of.
(milling) To brush the hairs or fuzz from (wheat grains, etc.) in the process of high milling.
An expression of approval; praise.
A special acknowledgment; an award.
An embrace of greeting or salutation.
A salutation marking the conferring of knighthood, consisting of an embrace or a kiss, and a slight blow on the shoulders with the flat of a sword.
A brace used to join two or more staves.

Written Presidential certificate recognizing service by personnel who died or were wounded in action between 1917 and 1918, or who died in service between 1941 and 1947, or died of wounds received in Korea between June 27, 1950 and July 27, 1954. Service of civilians who died overseas or as a result of injury or disease contracted while serving in a civilian capacity with the United States Armed Forces during the dates and/or in areas prescribed is in like manner recognized.

An ornament composed of two ogee curves meeting in the middle, each concave toward its outer extremity and convex toward the point at which it meets the other. Such accolades are either plain or adorned with rich moldings, and are a frequent motive of decoration on the lintels of doors and windows of the fifteenth and sixteenth centuries, especially in secular architecture.
To embrace or kiss in salutation.
To confer a knighthood on.
To confer praise or awards on.
definitions.example: an accoladed novel

definitions.definition: Either of the two characters { and }, i.e., left curly bracket left curly bracket and right curly bracket right curly bracket, with the shape of a curved, pointed line, having various uses in math, music, and computer programming.
A low-level flight, especially of military aircraft, of a ceremonial nature; a flypast (British).
A road or railway that passes over another, allowing routes to cross without interruption.
A high-level overpass built above main overpass lanes.
An alternating sequence of this kind.
To intersect.
To alternate between scenes from one sequence and scenes from another film sequence, often with the sequences to be perceived as simultaneous.
A rank in the classification of organisms, below family and above species; a taxon at that rank.
definitions.example: All magnolias belong to the genus Magnolia.

definitions.definition: A group with common attributes.
A natural number representing any of several related measures of the complexity of a given manifold or graph.
Within a definition, a broader category of the defined concept.
A schedule that allocates some task, responsibility or (rarely) privilege between a set of people according to a (possibly periodic) calendar.
A kind of zither, played like a guitar, used in the Middle Ages in church music.
The bust of an artist by the artist him/herself; a portrait of the painter who painted it.
For one thing; as one rebutting factor among many.
definitions.example: He can't be staring at you. For a start, he's asleep.

definitions.definition: Most inferior in quality or standing.
definitions.example: Travelling third-class isn't just slow, it's painful.

definitions.definition: (systems theory) A synonym of binding energy.
The cooperation of two or more nerves, muscles, organs, etc.
definitions.example: the digestive synergy

definitions.definition: The combined action of two or more drugs where the effects are stronger than their mere sum.
Benefits resulting from combining different groups, people, objects or processes.
Of or relating to a catalyst; having properties facilitating chemical reaction or change.
To fish excessively, often substantially reducing over several years the supply of one or more species of fish in an area.
Any gem, such as a diamond or ruby, that is expensive because of its rarity or desirability; especially one set into a piece of jewelry.
To bob up and down on horseback; jog.
A three-sided box for carrying bricks or other construction materials, often mortar. It bears a long handle and is carried over the shoulder.
A receptacle for carrying coal, particularly one designed to facilitate loading coal or coke through the door of a firebox.
A pewterer's blowpipe.
A bookmaker's bag.
To undergo mutation.
To cause mutation.
Extreme ideas or actions.
A small parasitic wingless insect of the order Psocodea.
(not usually used in plural form) A contemptible person; one who is deceitful or causes harm.
To remove lice from.
(grammar) The indicative mood.
(grammar) A term in the indicative mood.
Serving as a sign, indication or suggestion of something
definitions.example: He had pains indicative of a heart attack.

definitions.definition: (grammar) of, or relating to the indicative mood
An enthusiastic review (such as of a play).
An all-night dance party with electronic dance music (techno, trance, drum and bass etc.) and possibly drug use.
The genres of electronic dance music usually associated with rave parties.
To wander in mind or intellect; to be delirious; to talk or act irrationally; to be wild, furious, or raging.
To speak or write wildly or incoherently.
To talk with unreasonable enthusiasm or excessive passion or excitement; followed by about, of, or (formerly) on.
definitions.example: He raved about her beauty.

definitions.definition: To rush wildly or furiously.
To attend a rave (dance party).
One of the upper side pieces of the frame of a wagon body or a sleigh.
To tear apart by force; to rend; to split; to cleave.
To pierce or cleave with a weapon.
To land.
A woman involved in business.
To engage in a minor battle or dispute
A brief battle; a skirmish.
To toil, to work.
To belabour, to emphasise or expand upon (a point in a debate, etc).
definitions.example: I think we've all got the idea. There's no need to labour the point.

definitions.definition: To be oppressed with difficulties or disease; to do one's work under conditions which make it especially hard or wearisome; to move slowly, as against opposition, or under a burden.
To suffer the pangs of childbirth.
To pitch or roll heavily, as a ship in a turbulent sea.
The act of one who labours; toil; work done.
Danger pay.
The part of a baseball field which is beyond the infield and to the left of a person standing on home plate and facing the pitcher
The defensive position in the outfield to the left.
An unexpected, bizarre, or unwatched source (especially in the phrases out of left field and from left field).
definitions.example: Some of her comments really came from left field. I have no idea what she was thinking.

definitions.definition: An unusual or unexpected position, or a viewpoint held by very few others in contrast to the majority viewpoint (especially in the phrases out in left field and way out in left field)
An attack made in response to a previous offensive, and intended to stop it.
Being or relating to an attack in response to a previous offensive, and intended to stop it.
The quality of being queer or odd.
Something queer; an oddity.
The quality of being queer, in the sense of not conforming to sexual or gender norms.
Transported on the sea or ocean, especially by floating on the sea.
Not in good health; not feeling well; somewhat ill
Specifically, ill from menstruation; affected with, or having, catamenial; menstruant.
A band of strong tissue that connects bones to other bones.
That which binds or acts as a ligament.
A structure, whether artificial or natural, for housing a swarm of honeybees.
The bees of one hive; a swarm of bees.
A place swarming with busy occupants; a crowd.
A section of the registry.
To enter or possess a hive.
To form a hive-like entity.
To collect into a hive.
definitions.example: to hive a swarm of bees

definitions.definition: To store in a hive or similarly.
To take shelter or lodgings together; to reside in a collective body.
A guide or escort, especially one who rides in advance.
A forerunner.
A regulated diet.
Of, or relating to diet.
Comprising a food source.
Irritated, bad-tempered, unfriendly.
Threatening, menacing, gloomy.
definitions.example: The surly weather put us all in a bad mood.

definitions.definition: Lordly, arrogant, supercilious.
In an arrogant or supercilious manner.
Something that cannot be answered.
Not answerable; impossible to answer.
Impossible to dispute or rebut; irrefutable; conclusive.
Served in a package or takeout container so as to be taken away from a restaurant rather than eaten on the premises.
definitions.example: I'd like two burgers, two small orders of fries and two shakes, to go.

definitions.definition: Remaining. To finish. (In a group of events or items) belonging to the subgroup that have not passed or have not been finished or have not been addressed yet.
definitions.example: In my country, we go to public school for 12 years, and I have three more years to go.

definitions.definition: A public house that serves high-quality food.
Striving; earnest endeavor; hard work.
Exertion or contention for superiority, either by physical or intellectual means.
Bitter conflict, sometimes violent.
A trouble of any kind.
That which is contended against; occasion of contest.
A simplified representation of a smiling face.
A sequence of keyboard characters used to represent a happy mood, especially :) or :-) or other depiction of smiling.
An improvised street weapon consisting of a length of chain with padlocks and other heavy objects affixed to one end.
A roasted sheep's head.
The type of piercing of the upper frenulum (upper lip).
Cheerful and happy; smiling.
Having one's throat slit from side to side.
The act of theft, the act of stealing.
definitions.example: This instance of thievery will not be overlooked.

definitions.definition: That which is stolen.
Foul or unpleasant smell, especially body odor.

A style of music derived from 1960s soul music, with elements of rock and other styles, characterized by a prominent bass guitar, dance-friendly sound, a strong emphasis on the one, and much syncopation.
To emit an offensive smell; to stink.
To envelop with an offensive smell or smoke.
Spark.
Touchwood, punk, tinder.
Mental depression.
A state of fear or panic, especially cowardly.
One who fears or panics; a coward.
To shrink from, or avoid something because of fear.
To frighten; to cause to flinch.
A breed of dog, used for herding sheep.
A breed of dog used for guarding sheep.
A chaperon; an adult who accompanies other people in a supervisory role.
(police) A police officer.
To chaperon or shepherd.
Chewing gum sold as a ball usually coated with colored hard sugar.
definitions.example: Remember those clear globe dispensers with gumballs for a penny?

definitions.definition: A silly, laughable person.
definitions.example: When he drinks too much he's a gumball.

definitions.definition: The flashing lights on top of a police car.
To think about seriously.
definitions.example: Consider that we’ve had three major events and the year has hardly begun.

definitions.definition: To think about something seriously or carefully: to deliberate.
To think of doing.
definitions.example: I’m considering going to the beach tomorrow.

definitions.definition: (ditransitive) To assign some quality to.
definitions.example: Consider yourself lucky, but consider your opponent skillful.

definitions.definition: To look at attentively.
definitions.example: She sat there for a moment, considering him.

definitions.definition: To take up as an example.
definitions.example: Consider a triangle having three equal sides.

definitions.definition: (parliamentary procedure) To debate (or dispose of) a motion.
definitions.example: This body will now consider the proposed amendments to Section 453 of the zoning code.

definitions.definition: To have regard to; to take into view or account; to pay due attention to; to respect.
definitions.example: He never seems to consider the feelings of others.

definitions.definition: Consciously thoughtful and observant (often of other people); caring
definitions.example: It was very considerate of you to give up your place for your friend.

definitions.definition: Characterised by careful and conscious thought; deliberate
A kind of journalism that discusses a person or people in an emotional way so as to arouse interest or sympathy.
The upper leg of a human, between the hip and the knee.

That part of the leg of vertebrates (or sometimes other animals) which corresponds to the human thigh in position or function; the tibia of a horse, the tarsus of a bird; the third leg-section of an insect.
A rule or thesis in Sanskrit grammar or Hindu law or philosophy.
A scriptural narrative, especially a discourse of the Buddha.
To use; enjoy; have the full employment of.
To earn; deserve.
To bear; endure; support; put up with; tolerate (usually used in the negative, with an abstract noun as object).
definitions.example: I will not brook any disobedience.   I will brook no refusal.   I will brook no impertinence.

definitions.definition: A body of running water smaller than a river; a small stream.
A water meadow.
(in the plural) Low, marshy ground.
Of or pertaining to bad temper; showing anger easily or customarily.
definitions.example: His bad-tempered outburst caught his friends by surprise.

definitions.definition: The cry of a cat.
The drug mephedrone.
Of a cat, to make its cry.
The cry of a cat.
Said in reply to a spiteful or catty comment.
Said to denote seductiveness, mimicking a growl.
A spring onion, Allium fistulosum.
Any of various similar members of the genus Allium.
Any onion that lacks a fully developed bulb.
A leek.
Irritable, bad-tempered, grumpy or peevish.
Unable to relax; fidgety or restless.
In an incremental fashion; by small additions.
The practice of making unsolicited telephone calls or house calls to potential clients, voters or other groups in order to drum up custom or investigate intentions
An open hearth for holding a fire at the base of a chimney.
Closer to the mouth of a river
definitions.example: My house is downriver to his.

definitions.definition: Travelling in the direction of the river current.
definitions.example: It is easier to paddle downriver.

definitions.definition: A passage for pedestrians only.
(grammar) the infinitive mood or mode (a grammatical mood)

(grammar) A non-finite verb form considered neutral with respect to inflection; depending on language variously found used with auxiliary verbs, in subordinate clauses, or acting as a gerund, and often as the dictionary form.
(grammar) A verbal noun formed from the infinitive of a verb.
(grammar) Formed with the infinitive.
Unlimited; not bounded or restricted; undefined.
